meanings.definition: A person who is easily impressed or excited.
meanings.sent1: My little sister is such a wowsers when she sees a rainbow.
meanings.sent2: The children at the party were all wowsers when the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent3: The wowsers in the audience clapped and cheered loudly at the end of the magic show.
meanings.sent4: She was a wowsers, eyes wide with wonder, as she watched the fireworks light up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The wowsers in the group gasped in amazement as the acrobat performed daring stunts.

meanings.sent1: Wowsers! That was an incredible magic trick!
meanings.sent2: Wowsers, I can't believe how fast you ran in the race!
meanings.sent3: Wowsers, that cake is huge! Are you sure we can finish it all?
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened in wowsers as she saw the beautiful sunset over the ocean.
meanings.sent5: Wowsers, the fireworks lit up the sky in a burst of color and light!
